page.title: 16Old Buildings in Street
page.content: The oldest building in{Street}is the parish church of{Holy Trinity.}Parts of it date from the thirteenth century and it is believed that a Celtic church dedicated to {St. Theda }may have been built in Street in the first century A.D. Roman remains have been found in the churchyard. {The Grange,}parts of which were built in the sixteenth century was once known as the Manor of Street. It was at one time owned by William Strode of Barrington Court. The Barn next to the Grange was built in the fourteenth century by the Abbot of Glastonbury. {The Toll House}which stands in Glaston Rd., near the new bypass is probably 250 years old. {The Friends Meeting House}was built in 1850 to replace a smaller building. Its burial ground was bought in 1658.
